intro: Bulbinella latifolia subsp. denticulata, commonly known as the serrated bulbinella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and have finely serrated edges, giving it its subspecific name. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions of southeastern Australia.
